reviewText: Salo oh boy Salo where to even start. some people say its art others say its got a message if so i wouldn't know, all i know is i had to take a shower after watching this because my eyes where raped for 89 mins and my skin was crawling. this has got to be the mother of all disturbing cinema seriously. i read the reviews thinkin ok this will be yet another amazon user over-rated flick. nope not at all. in these 89 mins you get pretty much every sexual devient act you can think of with the exception of some beastiality lol. i mean everytime i thought to myself this can't get any worse it did. i gave this 4 stars cause it lived up to the hype but i don't really know how to rate this movie its definetly somthin i wouldn't watch again unless i was tryin to shock someone else. if your looking for somthing to reach that level of disturbia that some people need from of movie buy it now. if your looking at it for gore this aint for you.
summary: The movie i am ashamed to own

reviewText: If I had the option I'd actually give this 4.5 stars. Not as cathartic as it could have been. But this is what I would classify as a masterpiece of the basement genre. I counted 25 taboos broken.

reviewText: Read the other reviews first to understand the extreme bestiality portrayed in the movie. It is a transposition of MARQUIS DE SADE stories to SALO, a transient fascist Italian republic.The title of the review is a question asked and answered by SIMONE DE BEUVOIR. Her answer is a resounding NO, and I do concur. Nothing should be censured, even disgusting hate speech nor any kind of obscenities.I must caution though that the movie is difficult to watch, as other reviewers do underline. Personally, I found that the second part, "CIRCLE OF SHIT", was hard to swallow (pun intented !) Yes shit is part of life, but seeing naked virgins forced to eat it with a spoon or a "marriage" with a slave boy, dressed as a bride, and his master where they do kiss mouth to mouth with plenty of shit mixed in the kiss, were really difficult to watch.So you are warned ! It should not stop you to go ahead and watch it...As they say, there is no such thing as bad advertising and also the forbidden fruit attracts.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Evil.  Pure evil.This movie has every intention of figuratively bending your mind over and pounding repulsive images deep into your psyche.  Round after round of shocking, horrid, repulsive, disheartnening violence.  Brutally explicit raping and torturing of young teens.  The horror depicted in this film is way too gruesome and real for most people to even fathom.This is also an abhorrent display of power along with the depravity.  Aristocratic leaders collect the youth and totally corrupt them--both physically, mentally, and sexually.  It's a prison camp of torture and molestation.  And it's all shown in explicit fashion.  Seriously, it's so graphic you'll be begging for a break in the abuse.  An extremely hard film to watch.All the hype you've heard about this movie is true.  This version is much cheaper than the Criterion, but the shots are somewhat grainy and probably need some restoring.  Not that you'll want a better view.  Even if you're a certified gore hound, this film will have you tucking your tail between your legs and whimpering for salvation.  Proceed with the utmost caution.
summary: The total dehumanization of the human spirit

reviewText: I'm sure the movie was shocking in its day, and the story line is timeless. But with movies like Hostel and Human Centipede out there the scenes that were shocking in the 60's and 70's almost fall to the level of fetish play today.

reviewText: "SALO" is the most controversial film ever made, after "Deep Throat." Children are kidnapped and taken to a mansion where they are subjected to S&M cruelties. They eat feces and are raped and killed. Of course what you see isn't real. But it is enought to make many people sick to their stomach. Well, it's a movie, that's all. Just keep thinking to yourself, it's not real, it's not real. For mature adults only.
